title: Pageviews Analysis
total-pageviews: Pages by total number of pageviews
settings-notice: Your settings will be remembered on the same browser and computer.
date-notice: $1 provides data from $3 forward. For older data, try $2.
param-error-1: Pageviews API does not contain data older than $1. Sorry.
param-error-2: Start date must be older than the end date.
param-error-3: Invalid $1, using defaults instead. See the $2 for more information.
massviews-notice: To view more than $1 pages, try $2.
error-please-report: Please refresh the page to try again or report this issue
api-error-unknown: An unknown error occurred when querying $1
api-error-timeout:
Due to API failure, the following could not be processed:
$1
Please wait several minutes and try again.
api-incomplete-data: Some data is not yet available for the dates: $1
hover-to-exclude: To exclude pages from view, hover over their names and click the ✖
invalid-project: $1 is not a valid project or is currently unsupported.
invalid-lang-project: $1 is either invalid or not a multilingual project
faq-old-data-title: Why can't I view data older than $1?
faq-old-data-body: The Wikimedia pageviews API was introduced in August 2015 and has backfilled data to $1. You will have to rely on other tools such as stats.grok.se to view data older than this. Whether or not they work is unfortunately outside the scope of this tool, and beyond the control of the maintainers.
faq-todays-date-title: Why can't I view data for today's date?
faq-todays-date-body: The Wikimedia pageviews API generally takes a full 24 hours to populate, sometimes longer. In some situations you may see data missing for yesterday's date as well, which will be left blank rather than showing a count of zero views.
faq-redirects-body: If a user browses to a redirect, a pageview is registered for the redirect but not for the target page. If you want to get the total pageviews of a page including all redirects, try $1.
faq-search-redirects-title: How can I see the pageviews of redirects?
faq-search-redirects-body: To enable searching for redirects, change your search method to "$1" in the $2 panel. If you want to see the pageviews of all redirects to a page, try $3.
faq-counts-title: Are pageviews by the same user counted every time?
faq-counts-body: Yes. Every time you load a page, a pageview is registered, even if you created the page. You can learn more about the pageview definiton at $1.
faq-location-title: Can I see what geographical region the pageviews came from?
faq-location-body: The geographic location of readers on a per-page basis is not available. This is primarily for privacy reasons. You can however see the total pageviews by country across all Wikimedia sites at $1.
faq-referrals-title: Can I see how readers got to the page?
faq-referrals-body: Referral information is not publicly available on a per-page basis. You can however see total referral statistics across all Wikimedia sites at $1.
faq-date-dot: What are the dots next to the date labels?
faq-date-dot-body: This indicates the first day of the week. Pageviews tend to be low during the weekends, so this indicator can give perspective to the seven-day pattern.
faq-data-dumps: Can I download the full pageviews dataset for all pages?
faq-data-dumps-body: Yes. The full data dumps for all supported Wikimedia sites can be downloaded at $1.
faq-agents-user: includes all people who view a page. Editors, anonymous editors, and our readers.
faq-agents-spider: includes search engine "web crawlers" like Google that read pages for the purposes of improving search results. Pages can receive significant views from web crawlers, which is why by default the tool shows data only from users.
faq-agents-bot: includes any other automated programs that may scrape pages for other purposes.
faq-chart-type-title: How can I change the chart type?
faq-chart-type-body: Click "$1" to choose amongst 6 different types. The app will remember your preference. By default, the application will show a bar chart when viewing data for a single page, and a line chart for multiple pages. Note that the pie, doughnut and polar area charts can only show data for total number of views within the daterange.
faq-top-viewed-title: I want to see the top viewed pages within a date range
faq-multi-lang-title: I want to see data for a page across all languages of a project
faq-bug-report-title: I have a feature request or bug to report
faq-bug-report-body: If you would like to use a wiki to provide feedback, use the feedback forum on Meta. You can also report issues on Phabricator.
faq-topviews-false-positive-title: Why do some random pages have such high view counts?
faq-topviews-false-positive-body1: These are false positives, and unfortunately they are unavoidable. These could surface because someone used an automated program to scrape the page, for instance. One tactic to identify false positives is to compare desktop views with mobile web. First see which agents are most popular on your project for all articles, and use that as a basis for comparison for pages you believe may be false positives. For instance on the English Wikipedia mobile web views should be comparable if not higher than desktop, so if mobile web views are very low, it might be a false positive.
faq-topviews-false-positive-body2: You can also open any page in the Pageviews app for further analysis. Just click on the view count on the right side.
faq-topviews-false-positive-body3: You can report false positives to improve the $1 data. To do this, first exclude the page from view by hovering over it and clicking the ✖ in the beginning of the line. Then click on the '$2' link above the '$3' input. If enough people report a particular page as a false positive, it may be automatically excluded from view for all users.
faq-source-pageviews: is the total number of pageviews the project received.
faq-source-unique-devices: is the number of unique devices that visited the site.
faq-massviews-sources-pagepile: Enter the numeric ID of a set of pages created with $1.
faq-massviews-sources-category: Enter the full URL of a category page, for example $1.
faq-massviews-sources-wikilinks: Enter the full URL of any page, for example $1.
faq-massviews-sources-template: Enter the full URL of a template page, for example $1.
faq-massviews-sources-subpages: Enter the full URL of any page, for example $1.
faq-massviews-sources-external-link: Enter a URL pattern, for example $1. See the $2 for more information.
faq-massviews-sources-hashtag: Enter a hashtag with or without the hash ($1) character, for example $2. The result set may include pages across multiple wikis. See the $3 for more information. This feature is primarily for editathons and outreach purposes.
faq-massviews-sources-quarry: Enter the numeric ID and project of a $1 dataset. The $2 column (required) is what will be used as the page titles.
faq-massviews-subject-page-body: This option is for when you are using a category as the source. In some cases the category may contain talk pages when you actually want the subject pages. For instance FA-Class New York City articles, which lists the talk pages of FA-quality articles within WikiProject New York City.
url-structure-example:
To get the latest data on a given page on your wiki, with default options, use:
$1
replacing $2 with a valid $3. $4 will resolve to the page the link is placed on
url-structure-example-siteviews:
To get the latest data on total pageviews of all pages on your wiki, with default options, use:
$1
url-structure-topviews-example:
To show the default list of top viewed pages on your wiki, use:
$1
replacing $2 with a valid $3. You can also use $4 to exclude certain pages from view, such as known false positives.
url-structure-topviews-date: A date representing either a specific day or month, or a relative range. May be one of the following:
url-structure-topviews-date-month: A specific month in the format $1
url-structure-topviews-date-day: A specific day in the format $1
url-structure-parameters-order: Can be used in any order
url-structure-projects: Valid $1 separated by | characters. For example $2
url-structure-project-multilang: The provided source project must be multilingual. For example $1 or $2
url-structure-pages: Escaped page names separated by | characters such as Cat|Dog (default)
url-structure-excludes: Escaped page names to exclude from the view separated by | characters, such as false-positives or irrelevant pages. For example Main_page|Special:Search
url-structure-onwiki-link: For linking to the current page on wiki, use $1
url-structure-special-range: A special range to use instead of exact $1 and $2 dates. May be one of the following:
url-structure-special-range-latest-n: where N is a number. For example latest-30 will show the last 30 days of data
url-structure-start-date:
Start date in the format $1.
Omit this parameter and the $2 parameter to show the most recent data.
Using the format $3 will be treated as the start month, and show monthly data instead of daily.
url-structure-end-date:
End date in the format $1, defaults to previous day.
Using the format $2 will be treated as the end month, and show monthly data instead of daily.
url-structure-agent: One of $1 (human viewer, default), $2 (search engine crawlers), $3 (WMF bots) or $4 ($1, $2 and $3)
url-structure-sort-direction: The sort direction. $1 for descending, $2 for ascending
url-structure-source: Either $1 (total page views) or $2 (number of unique devices that viewed the site)
url-structure-massviews-example:
Example URL for PagePile: $1
Example URL for a category: $2
To link to Massviews on a category page on your wiki, use:
$3
url-structure-massviews-target: The Page Pile ID, or full URL to a category. If a question mark ? is in the URL, it must be encoded.
url-structure-massviews-target-example: For instance, do not use: $1 Instead use: $2 Or you could simply use the shorter wiki URL: $3
url-structure-massviews-project: A valid $1 for the pages of Quarry results.
url-structure-view: $1 to view the data as a list, or $2 to view the data as a chart
url-structure-subjectpage: Sets the "$1" option when using categories as the source. Use $2 to enable, or $3 to disable (default).
url-structure-autolog: Set to $1 to disable automatically setting the $2 option
unsupported-browser-error: $1 and below is not supported. Please upgrade your browser.
topviews-false-positive: Some pages listed may be false positives.
massviews-oversized-set: $1 contains $2 pages. For performance reasons, only the first $3 pages will be processed.
massviews-oversized-set-unknown: $1 contains over $2 pages. For performance reasons, only the first $2 pages will be processed.
massviews-redirect:
You have been redirected from $1 because you requested more than $2 pages.
$3 was automatically created and will be processed.
massviews-category-description: Get the pageviews of pages in a $1
massviews-wikilinks-description: Get the pageviews of linked pages on a page
massviews-external-link-description: Get the pageviews of pages containing an $1
massviews-pagepile-description: Get the pageviews of pages in a $1
massviews-subpages-description: Get the pageviews of a page and all of its $1
massviews-transclusions-description: Get the pageviews of pages that transclude a template
massviews-quarry-description: Get the pageviews of pages returned by a $1 query
massviews-hashtag-description: $1. Get the pageviews of pages that have edits with the given $2 in the edit summary
pageviews-description: Comparison of pageviews across multiple pages
topviews-description: Most viewed pages of a project
langviews-description: Pageviews of a page across all languages
massviews-description: Import a list of pages and compare the pageviews
siteviews-description: Comparison of total pageviews across multiple projects
redirectviews-description: Pageviews of all redirects to a page
invalid-category-url: Invalid category! Please enter the full wiki URL of the category.
invalid-page-url: Invalid page! Please enter the full wiki URL of the page.
invalid-quarry-dataset: Invalid Quarry dataset! The $1 column is required but was not found.
category-subject-toggle: Use subject page instead of talk page
bezier-curve-option: Use Bézier curve on line charts
autolog-option: Automatically use logarithmic scale if applicable
begin-at-zero-option: Always show the y-axis starting at zero
auto-pagepile-error: Unable to create $1. Showing the first $2 requested pages.
report-false-positive-text: Use this form to choose which excluded pages you want to report as false positive ($1)
report-false-positive-submitted: Your false positive report has been submitted. Thanks for improving $1 data!
new-article-warning: One or more of the requested pages were recently created, so the pageviews data may not be available yet ($1)
